lenders.name: Claire
lenders.loan_because: It's not much of a burden for me, but it can make a world of a difference for someone else.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: We loan because together, we wish to live lives of Christian faithfulness to God's command of justice. Recognizing God's call to justice (Micah 6:8) we want to reflect a commitment to help others in need. I loan because the triune God calls us to care for others in ways that recognize their dignity.  and efforts to provide for others. I recognize God's calling to seek to alleviate poverty by sharing a portion of what God has graciously given to me. In this way, I can express the love of Christ to others.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a teacher (College) and help students to understand Christianity. I love Christ and know that by helping others, I can be a faithful witness to the love and mercy of God.

lenders.name: Annemarie M
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference

lenders.name: Sean
lenders.loan_because:
I want to help those less fortunate than myself. I have been blessed to have a somewhat successful career and blessed to live in one of the most beautiful and affluent areas of the world.

I have run my own businesses in the past (aviation training and technical publication consulting) and understand what it is to struggle, so I want to help others to succeed, whether they are across the world or right here in the United States.

I firmly believe that the only way any of us can truly succeed in life and business is to help others in their own struggle to succeed. To give of our time, energy, and knowledge and to lend our financial assistance when we can.
lenders.occupational_info:
I create technical documents for High Tech companies in the Silicon Valley area of Northern California (USA). Those documents range from consumer product user manuals to highly detailed technical references for software developers, engineers, and scientists.

I am also a Certificated Commercial Pilot and Flight Instructor. My flight training career spanned more than 30 years from 1975 until my retirement from teaching in 2006. In that time, I trained hundreds of aviators, some of whom are now successful pilots with major airlines.

I have, since my high school days, been an avid photographer, and have recently launched a professional photography business in which I provide wedding, event, and product photography.

lenders.loan_because: i can. And because I hope to be able to help others achieve their dreams.

lenders.name: Mayen
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people achieve better lives. I think we forget a lot in the west how we started and often take everyday things for granted. It's all about getting the bigger house, the newest car, the latest gadget, the trendiest clothes and such. I'm tired of such materialism. Refrigerators, sewing machines, food processors, motorcycles, washing machines, electricity, running water, etc., unfortunately seem mundane to many people who grew up with such luxuries. Yet those whose businesses critically rely on them, are the ones who really need them the most. I rather spend my money on things that actually matter.

lenders.name: Rodney Howard Browne
lenders.loan_because:
What God Wants Us to Hear by Rodney Howard Browne

Put simply, stick with the evangelizing plan God has sure to praise and use. Don't try and be so creative and adorable that folks miss the truth. No need for unintelligible and crazy substitutes that entertain but barely convict the lost and edify the saved. Will you notice something here? This exhortation isn't addressed to the hearer, it's for the spokesman.

The person that is to do that's the one exclaiming the message. Be ready to do it in season and out of season. Don't get on up and begin with an apology that you didn't quite have sufficient time to prepare.

That doesn't wash." And do so faithfully when it's convenient and when it's not. Sadly , in a shocking number of churches today, God's people are being told what they have to hear rather than what they have to hear. A watered-down gospel may attract gigantic crowds ( for some considerable time ), but it has no never-ending impact. I can't say I have been capable of finding any place in the Scriptures where God expresses the least bit of doubt for drawing numbers.

Enjoyable the curious itching ears of our postmodern audiences is an exercise in futility.

Frankly , I'm going to resume doing exactly that, by God's grace, until the day He calls me home. And I think there is a fast-increasing number of supporters who long for nutritive messages based on the Word of the Lord Almighty not human standpoint. The world urgently needs more Christians with the fervor and faith of Paul. Will you be one of them? Will you reply the charge? If this is the case there's no better time than now to start.  

Read more about Rodney Howard Browne on these sites:

http://brightkite.com/people/rhbrownebiz
http://community.adlandpro.com/members/rhbrownebiz.aspx
http://en.netlog.com/rhbrownebiz

lenders.name: Rodney Howard
lenders.loan_because:
The Sacrifice by Rodney Howard Browne

His words and his demeanor are so understated, so matter-of-fact, that it is straightforward to miss the drama of this scene.

If I were about to sacrifice my only boy, who embodied all the guarantees that God had ever made to me, I might be overcome with emotion. "I don't understand why God is making me do this, but I am going to do as he is exclaiming. So I'm going up that mountain to sacrifice my boy on that altar, then I'm going home to cry this terrible loss for what's left of my life. According to the book of Hebrews, Abraham knew 3 critical facts.

First, Isaac was to be the vehicle of Almighty God's guarantees ; Isaac must live. Third, God's power is total, even over the power of death. Obviously , Abraham didn't tell Isaac everything he knew about what was to happen on the mountain.

we will not be sure why he withheld that information. Maybe to spare his boy unnecessary fear or fear. But my opinion is that when God does a transforming work in you that involves a trial, he is not testing folks ; he's testing you. Infrequently , strength is mustered in keeping it to ourselves. They've got a knife, wood, and fire for the sacrifice. "Where is the sacrifice?" I love Abraham's answer. "God will provide." The Hebrew uses an idiom that sounds just like something a pop would say today.
